definition: building/shop/term for certain service establishments/embassy or consulate/schoolroom (old)/CL:家[jia1]

sentences.english: Lime tree coffee shop reminds me of Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 酸橙树咖啡馆使我想起了洛杉矶。

sentences.english: The town offers many shops and cafes and a wide variety of entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 镇上有许多商店和咖啡馆以及各种各样的文娱活动。

sentences.english: Rue Maarad cafes and restaurants off Place d'Etoile.
sentences.chinese: 马阿拉路的星辰广场上的咖啡馆及餐厅。

sentences.english: He approached her one evening at the Café du Relais Saint-Michel.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上他在圣米歇尔海滩咖啡馆朝她走过去。

sentences.english: Phoebe finds a police badge under a cushion at the coffee house.
sentences.chinese: 菲比在咖啡馆的沙发垫下发现一枚警察徽章。

sentences.english: My expectations of an internet cafe changed in a buttie's bite.
sentences.chinese: 咬了一口三明治，我对互联网咖啡馆的期望就改变了。

sentences.english: We went to a cafe and lazed the whole afternoon away there.
sentences.chinese: 我们去了一间咖啡馆，在那儿消磨了整个下午。

sentences.english: Nights I set up the coffeehouse we ran.
sentences.chinese: 晚上又开始经营自己的咖啡馆。

sentences.english: The Act applies to all restaurants and cafes .
sentences.chinese: 该条法令适用于全部餐馆和咖啡馆。

sentences.english: ZECY:There is a new free-standing cafe near the downtown.
sentences.chinese: 在市中心区附近有座新的独立咖啡馆。

sentences.english: In a corner of the café, an acetylene lamp gives a flickering light.
sentences.chinese: 一盏电石灯在咖啡馆的角落里闪烁不定。

sentences.english: His learning came not only from books but from bars and cafs.
sentences.chinese: 他的学识不仅来自于书本，也来自于酒吧和咖啡馆。

sentences.english: Each cafe has a distinct fortune-telling method.
sentences.chinese: 每家咖啡馆都有其独特的算命方式。

sentences.english: I met her in a small, untidy coffeehouse on the outskirts of London.
sentences.chinese: 我是在伦敦郊外的一个狭小凌乱的咖啡馆遇见她的。

sentences.english: This cafe, which has just opened in Tokyo, is not for the faint-hearted.
sentences.chinese: 这个咖啡馆刚刚在东京开业，胆小者最好勿进。

sentences.english: Regardless of Paris or other provinces, cafes everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 无论巴黎还是外省，咖啡馆满目皆是。
